page.title: 09Services
page.content: The electricity supply from the West Midlands Electricity Board meets most energy needs. Most lines are overhead but there are some underground cables. Cooking and heating are either by solid fuel or electricity and occasionally by calor gas. There is no mains gas supply. Open fires are still found in many dwellings as the area is not a smokeless zone. Many farms use irrigation, pumping water from the River Roden up to an amount specified by the Severn Trent Water Board. Other services available in this area are mains water supply, mains drainage, telephone and post. One smallholding has its own borehole supply of water. Roads are maintained by the Local Authority.
